abstract: Modifies the date format style to use the specified year format style.

codeExamples.code:
let meetingDate = Date() // Feb 9, 2021 at 3:00 PM
meetingDate.formatted(Date.FormatStyle().year(.defaultDigits)) // 2021
meetingDate.formatted(Date.FormatStyle().year(.twoDigits)) // 21
meetingDate.formatted(Date.FormatStyle().year(.padded(6))) // 002021

## Return Value

A date format style modified to include the specified year format style.

## Discussion

Possible values of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year] include [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year/twoDigits], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year/padded(_:)], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year/relatedGregorian(minimumLength:)], and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year/extended(minimumLength:)].

This example shows a variety of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year] formats applied to a date:

If you don’t provide a format, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Day/defaultDigits] static variable is the default format.

For more information about formatting dates, see [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle].

# year(_:)

**Instance Method**

Modifies the date format style to use the specified year format style.

## Declaration

```swift
func year(_ format: Date.FormatStyle.Symbol.Year = .defaultDigits) -> Date.FormatStyle
```

## Parameters

- **format**: The year format style applied to the date format style.

## Return Value

A date format style modified to include the specified year format style.

## Discussion

Possible values of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year] include [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year/twoDigits], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year/padded(_:)], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year/relatedGregorian(minimumLength:)], and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year/extended(minimumLength:)].

This example shows a variety of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Year] formats applied to a date:

```swift
let meetingDate = Date() // Feb 9, 2021 at 3:00 PM
meetingDate.formatted(Date.FormatStyle().year(.defaultDigits)) // 2021
meetingDate.formatted(Date.FormatStyle().year(.twoDigits)) // 21
meetingDate.formatted(Date.FormatStyle().year(.padded(6))) // 002021
```

If you don’t provide a format, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle/Symbol/Day/defaultDigits] static variable is the default format.

For more information about formatting dates, see [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Date/FormatStyle].

## Specifying the Date Format

- **day(_:)**: Modifies the date format style to use the specified day format style.
- **dayOfYear(_:)**: Modifies the date format style to use the specified day of the year format style.
- **era(_:)**: Modifies the date format style to use the specified era format style.
- **month(_:)**: Modifies the date format style to use the specified month format style.
- **quarter(_:)**: Modifies the date format style to use the specified quarter format style.
- **week(_:)**: Modifies the date format style to use the specified week format style.
- **weekday(_:)**: Modifies the date format style to use the specified weekday format style.
- **Date.FormatStyle.DateStyle**: Type that defines date styles varied in length or components included.

items.description: Modifies the date format style to use the specified day format style.
